commander.name: Unknown
commander.notes: Division commander for Q1 1941 not yet identified in sources. Regiment commanders identified: Panzer-Regiment 5 commanded by Oberst Dr. Ing. Herbert Olbrich (13 Nov 1940 - 30 Apr 1941)

subordinate_units.notes: Equipment data not yet extracted. Some sources mention MG-Btl. 2 and MG-Btl. 8 instead

panzer_iii.notes: Likely mix of Ausf. E, F, G with 3.7cm or 5cm gun. Lost 10 units in ship fire before landing

panzer_iv.notes: Likely Ausf. D or E with short 7.5cm gun. Lost 3 units in ship fire before landing

panzerbefehlswagen.notes: Typically Pz.Bef.Wg. III or converted Pz.III

subordinate_units.notes: Tank strength as of 10 March 1941. By 11 April 1941, only 25 tanks operational due to sand filter problems
Deployed to 5. leichte Division in early 1941. Equipment counts not yet extracted. Standard light artillery battalion typically has 12 guns (3 batteries × 4 guns), likely 10.5cm leFH 18
Arrived Tripoli 14 February 1941. Equipment counts not yet extracted
Arrived Libya January 1941, attached February 1941. Equipment counts not yet extracted. Likely equipped with 3.7cm PaK 35/36 and/or 5cm PaK 38
Unit number not yet identified. Equipment data not yet extracted
Later became Panzer-Divisions-Nachrichten-Abteilung 200. Equipment data not yet extracted

personnel.notes: Personnel data not yet extracted from sources. NO ESTIMATION USED per user requirements

tanks.notes: CONFIRMED from Lexikon der Wehrmacht, Panzer-Regiment 5 strength as of 10 March 1941. Variant designations (Ausf.) not yet identified

artillery.notes: Artillery equipment counts not yet extracted. I./Artillerie-Regiment 75 confirmed present, equipment TBD. Panzerjäger-Abteilung 39 confirmed present, AT gun counts TBD

ground_vehicles.notes: Vehicle counts not yet extracted from sources. NO ESTIMATION USED per user requirements

aircraft.notes: No organic air assets - Luftwaffe support separate from division

primary_sources: Lexikon der Wehrmacht - Panzer-Regiment 5 equipment data
